title._content: [Turtle Bay Gardens, 227-47 East 48 Street and 242-46 East 49 Street, New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Turtle Bay Gardens, 227-47 East 48 Street and 242-46 East 49 Street, New York, New York. View to fountain between east loggias] [1920 Fall] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture and landscape: Edward Clarence Dean and William Lawrence Bottomley, 1919-1920. Associated Name: Charlotte Bronson Hunnewell Sorchan, developer. Other: Fountain designed by William Lawrence Bottomley and cast by J.C. Kraus, New York. Today: Extant. On slide: Blue star sticker and red seal sticker. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16651 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 7
